title: Champion Q&A: Illaoi, the Kraken Priestess
body:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/scale_xlarge/public/upload/illaoi_ama.jpg

**Thanks for participating everybody! We hope you have as much fun playing Illaoi as we did working on her.**

**May you go forth in constant motion, and remember: life is the sweetness of fruit, and the joy of battle!**

Hey everybody!

We've gathered a bunch of Rioters from the Illaoi team for some Q&A about the Kraken Priestess! Whether you're interested in Illaoi's gameplay, story, art, or fun stories from her development, ask away and we'll be happy to answer!

Check out these links if you need to get up to speed:

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_small/public/upload/illaoi-reveal-banner.jpg
[Champion Reveal: Illaoi, the Kraken Priestess](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/champion-reveal-illaoi-kraken-priestess): Check out Illaoi's reveal.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_small/public/upload/il-in-banner.jpg
[Champion Insights: Illaoi, the Kraken Priestess](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/champions-skins/champion-preview/champion-insights-illaoi): Hear about the process behind Illaoi's creation.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_small/public/upload/promo_image.jpg
[Trial of the Kraken Priestess](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/champions/trial-of-the-kraken-priestess): Fight for your soul... if you have the courage.

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/sites/default/files/styles/wide_small/public/upload/illaoi_spotlight_thumbnail.jpg
[Illaoi Champion Spotlight](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UFkCDRlb9FA): Everything you need to know to tentakill the opposition.

Now... let's get kraken!

Illaoi is the first champ I've seen released since I've been playing the game to not really have any CC. Yes Rek'Sai has her knock up but Rek can use it more often than Illaoi's situational slow on her E and Rek has her tunnel vision as extra utility. Is there any particular reason you decided to forgo utility aspects of her in kit in favor of an almost completely damage oriented champion?

By definition, the juggernaut class has very low access to hard CC and is intended to be a situational damage threat. They should bring some form of unique utility to the game which is where Test of Spirit comes in to play.

Yay question time! Before I go in though; great job on Illaoi, she's awesome in every aspect!

1. Does Illaoi's religion have a name? If so what do they call practitioners?
2. What's Buhru like and where's it located? Got any historical tidbits about it?
3. Is the language Illaoi speaks specific to Buhru and are there any other details on the language itself to tell?
4. What are the Serpent Isles? I'm led to believe they're a part of the Blue Flame archipelago where the Serpentine flows through but I dunno.
5. Could you explain a bit about the nature of Illaoi's idol? Is it a literal or metaphorical "eye of god" so to speak?
6. Illaoi has a line for when she buys {{item:3053} saying "Sterak? It is the fury of the **Mother** I will bring." The mother is obviously Nagakabouros so who is Sterak in relation? Her consort? One of her direct children?
7. On that note what's the historical and religious significance of sea monsters in Illaoi's religion? Do they have a specific connection to Nagakabouros?
8. Linked in with the above, what are Runeterran Hydras like? Are they real or mythological in universe?
9. Considering the oceanic themes present in Illaoi's religion what's her thoughts on our resident sea-dwellers: {{champion:105}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:111}}?
10. I imagine there's a few good myths and legends about Nagakabouros. Care to divulge any? Would love to hear what the story is behind her origins.
11. Final question! What's a Paylangi? Illaoi called people it in Shadow and Fortune and I'm just sitting here wondering what the sod it means.

EDIT: Sod forgot one. FINAL QUESTION:

- Is there some correlation between Nagakabouros, the souls of living beings, and the forever mysterious demons and darkin? I'm assuming those two kinds of beings are very distinct from everything included in the Maelstrom, and I'm wondering if they're even a part of it at all.

1.  Illaoi's people aren't really aware of other religions (though they have other gods too).  So they haven't needed a name for it.

2.  Buhru is an island near Bilgewater.  Both are in the Serpent Isles' chain.

3.  The various islands have distinct dialects-- similar to Scottish vs English vs Welsh.    Burhun is the one of the most common dialects as it is especially suited for sea travel.

4.    Bilgewaterian's and many others have adopted the translation of the natives' name for the island chain.  Blue Flame is the old Valorian name for the island chain-- and you would be unlikely to hear anyone but Demacian's call it that.

5.  Eye of God is its title.    This is ultimately because of the way a Truth Bearer uses it.

6.   While a fiercely intelligent woman, keep in mind Illaoi is from a far, isolated corner of the world.   She often doesn't know who people are-- but wants everyone to understand they are below her god.

7. See above.

8.  Illaoi knows Hydra's etc.. exist.    (But Runeterra is a big place other characters esp-- in Piltover might be surprised to find out they exist)

9.  Pass  (to complicated to explain-- they will be getting lore reddux soon)

10.   I'm hoping we will be releasing some of the story sketches I wrote for her  (along with other champs like Tahm Kench, rek sai etc..)  That would give some insights about the world. 

11.  Paylangi.    "Pink face."   A derogatory term for Valorians and Ionians.
